TopicTitle: Satellite. is this part of the game???

Articles.Content:
So I got the satellite to Mun to do an orbit contract, and of course I had the wrong rotation. So I decided to see if I can reverse my orbit.

I get lined up with the opposing path within reasonable deviation before I reverse my orbit.

When I added the maneuver and began my burn, it flipped the rotation for me automatically, and actually took very very little fuel.

is the flip maneuver a feature in the game or did I do something?

regardless, super helpful.

Maybe a bug or something?

O you had a high TWR and a lot of delta-v and didn't realized how short the burn was?
I've done a 180 degree inclination reversal in orbit of Minmus with no problem, but have never tried it around the Mun.
how exactly did you do this with the maneuver controls?

You just had a high TWR. The Mun has a lot less gravity than Kerbin so it's easy to underestimate how overpowered your engine might be in relation to the weight of your craft. Doing a 180 reversal is pretty cheap around the Mun. The higher your orbit, the cheaper it becomes.
When needing to alter my inclination (or 'do a 180) ive found it uses less overall dV to increase your apoapsis, do the turn at apoapsis then lower your apoapsis again.

I had to do that with a manned craft at 16 km, and it actually worked, though that craft was well over 10t. Given how small satellites usually are it's a perfectly reasonable maneuver. Just don't attempt it on anything larger than the Mun, as it gets exponentially more risky form there due to higher orbital speeds.
